review: I found the Fire TV lived up to it's expectations fairly well. The video quality is very good and even with our problematic internet on Comcast in an apartment building, it holds up playing Netflix with only an occasional stutter. I do like the feature that when there is a stutter, the audio is untouched and stays in sync.  I do wish that Amazon had included the Prime video only selection as it takes longer to find a prime video.  We installed a Microsoft Xbox 360 controller for Windows and have played Sev Zero and Walking Dead. Both do show impressive performance for such a modest device. However, what I did not expect was that the memory to have more than a couple games and a modest selection of apps falls short.  In the case of these games, it means that you can't just flip between a library of them and instead play only one or two favorites  and unload them when you want another.  Perhaps, the Amazon Game Studio could use the cloud to load in content as needed and solve this issue.  It is this reason that I didn't give the full five star rating.  Now one more thing that bugs me, where are the thousands of new games promised in April?  Having bought a controller for $40 for two modest games seems silly now. Please at least pre announce the new ones so we can have hope that the promise of Android Gaming will come to pass on the Fire TV.
